member.name: T:Inversion.Spring.BehaviourObjectDefinitionParser
member.summary: Implements a parser that is able to parse behaviour definitions in a Spring XML object config.

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.BehaviourObjectDefinitionParser.GetObjectTypeName(System.Xml.XmlElement)
member.summary: Obtains the fully qualified type name of the object represented by the XML element.
member.returns: Returns the fully qualified type name for the object being described.

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.BehaviourObjectDefinitionParser.DoParse(System.Xml.XmlElement,Spring.Objects.Factory.Support.ObjectDefinitionBuilder)
member.summary: Parse the supplied XmlElement and populate the supplied ObjectDefinitionBuilder as required.
member.param: The builder used to build the object definition in Spring.

member.name: P:Inversion.Spring.BehaviourObjectDefinitionParser.ShouldGenerateIdAsFallback
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether an ID should be generated instead if the passed in XmlElement does not specify an "id" attribute explicitly.

member.name: T:Inversion.Spring.BehaviourNamespaceParser
member.summary: Registers tags to be used in configuration with the class that will process those tags.

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.BehaviourNamespaceParser.Init
member.summary: Invoked by after construction but before any elements have been parsed.

member.name: T:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer
member.summary: A service container backed by Sprint.NET

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.#ctor
member.summary: Instantiates a new service container, and configures it from the Spring config.
member.remarks: In most cases you'll probably just want to use `ServiceContainer.Instance`

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.#ctor(Spring.Context.IApplicationContext)
member.summary: Instantiates a new service container using the provided application context.
member.param: You can think of this `container` as the underlying Spring backing. This is "the thing".

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources maintained by the current context instance.

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Disposal that allows for partitioning of clean-up of managed and unmanaged resources.
member.remarks: This is looking conceited and should probably be removed. I'm not even sure I can explain a use case for it in terms of an Inversion context.

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.GetService(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the service if any of the provided name.
member.param: The name of the service to obtain.
member.returns: Returns the service of the specified name.

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.GetService(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the service if any of the provided name. Further asserts that the service is on an expected type.
member.param: The name of the service to obtain.
The type the service is expected to be.
member.returns: Returns the service of the specified name.

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.GetService``1(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the service if any of the provided name and type.
member.typeparam: The type of the service being obtained.
member.param: The name of the service to obtain.
member.returns: Returns the service of the specified name.

member.name: M:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.ContainsService(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the container has a service of a specified name.
member.param: The name of the service to check for.
member.returns: Returns true if the service exists; otherwise returns false.

member.name: P:Inversion.Spring.ServiceContainer.Instance
member.summary: A singleton instance of the service container.
